newsitem.title: INDIA: Philippines in market for 200,000 T India rice.
newsitem.headline: Philippines in market for 200,000 T India rice.

text.p: Indian rice exporters said on Thursday that the Philippines is considering buying about 200,000 tonnes of rice from India.
"The Philippines government is actively considering importing about 200,000 tonnes rice from India," said Tarun Kumar, a senior official of foodgrains exporter Space Group.
Kumar said Indian exporters had briefed Philippine President Fidel Ramos and the accompanying trade delegation on the quality of rice during their visit to India earlier this month
"They have shown good interest," Kumar told Reuters.
Indian exporters said the Philippine government has authorised the National Food Authority of Philippines to buy 650,000 tonnes of rice.
Traders said Philippines was mainly interested in buying 15 percent broken non-Basmati rice.
"It is expected that the National Food Authority will come out with a favourable decision (on Indian rice purchases) during the current week," said one exporter who asked not to be identified.
